text: I asked @amyklobuchar what someone who doesn't like her would say about her: "I think you've heard some of it. Some people might say that I can be too tough, and I push things too hard." She adds that's a "fair criticism." #MTP
author: chucktodd

text: .@amyklobuchar tells me she's a progressive: "I'm in the getting-things-done lane. And I am a progressive, when you look at what I've stood up for my whole career. But I also think it's important when you can find common ground so you get things done" #MTP

text: How will @BetoORourke's candidacy be different others? He says being the only one running from a border state is a difference maker "at a time that that dominates so much of our national conversation and legislative efforts and the things that the president talks about."
author: chucktodd

text:
Would @BetoORourke be in Iowa this week if he hadn't lost that Texas Senate race?

He told me: "I don't know that I would be in Waterloo, and Keokuk, and all the other communities I've been in to run for president." 

#MTP

text: Most SOTUs are a bit disjointed; they usually sound like they were written by committee because they usually are. This speech seemed to truly lack a coherent theme... series of ideas and complaints with only immigration as a centerpiece
author: chucktodd

text: During the touching tribute to the Pittsburgh SWAT officer, POTUS has left out the shooter’s other motive for the shooting besides anti-semitism... the shooter was angry with the Tree of Life’s support for refugees
author: chucktodd

text: Interesting to hear POTUS go out of his way to be vague about who the U.S. is negotiating with in Afghanistan... trying to downplay the fact that essentially the U.S. is negotiating with the Taliban.  “The other side” etc... he went with that phrase twice.
author: chucktodd

text: This is a speech being dominated by immigration and the wall now... everything else will look like window dressing post-SOTU compared to his focus and fury over immigration.  This feels like he’s decided he wants the issue for 2020 more than getting this issue behind him in 2019.
author: chucktodd
